page.title: 15EARLS HALL
page.content: Earls Hall is an old house and belongs to the farmer. The Hall is a private house and the farmer is an Arable farmer although he has some sheep and cows. There are several farm buildings, some old and some build recently. Some of the crops growing included potatoes,peas,grass and wheat. Also on the farm are offices and stores for the machinery and a cow shed. The land-use of the farm for this year was roughly 53% cereals, 27%grass, and the rest was mainly peas and potatoes. Earls Hall is found down a small track off the St Osyth main road and stretches up to Hartley Wood.
